newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-BARSOSIO CLINCHES FIRST MAJOR TITLE BY KENYAN WOMAN.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-BARSOSIO CLINCHES FIRST MAJOR TITLE BY KENYAN WOMAN.

text.p: Sally Barsosio ran alone over the last three laps to clinch the first global title for a Kenyan woman in the world women's 10,000 metres final on Tuesday.
Barsosio, a bronze medallist at the 1993 championships in Stuttgart, broke away from Olympic and world champion Fernanda Ribeiro to win in 31 minutes 32.92 seconds.
Ribeiro hung on to take second in 31:39.15 with Japan's Masako Chiba third in 31:41.93.
Barsosio was fortunate to be reinstated after disqualification in Stuttgart because she caused problems in the race by running across several runners.
In the ninth lap on Tuesday, Ribeiro pointed at the Kenyan as if she were complaining about her position just outside her at the front of the pack.
After a slow start, Chiba and Chinese Yang Siju made the early pace before Ribeiro hit the front in the seventh lap with Barsosio right behind.
With eight laps remaining, Ethiopia's Olympic bronze medallist Gete Wami dropped out after hurting her foot.
Barsosio picked up the pace with three laps to go and burst away from the pack. She managed to quickly take a 10 metres lead over Ribeiro and was a good 50 metres ahead at the finish.
